title: "gt" package usage!
description:
About the workshop: Using the "gt" package to create great tables

About the instructor: Pavitra Chakravarty is a data scientist at Converging Health, Dallas TX. She is also a proud @DallasRLadies member

title: R for Data Science book club Asia
description:
We are extremely happy to announce that we will be joining the R4DS Book club Asia (cohort 3) with the support of R4DS Online Learning Community.
It will be a weekly session with a rotation of participants as presenters (who will be reading the book and presenting each week).
R for Data Science will teach you how to do data science using R!

üì£
Important instructions:
- For more details please join - r4ds.io/join. This is the common place for all communication for the book club.
- Here is an online version of the book we will be discussing - https://r4ds.had.co.nz/.
- When: 08 December 2020 at 8:00 am IST or 2:30 am UTC (recurring Tuesdays)
Where: Zoom (more details posted on slack- r4ds.io/join)
What: For the first meetup, we will be covering the introduction chapter, and also using it to discuss how to run the club with ease.
- All the materials will be posted here - https://github.com/r4ds/bookclub-R_for_Data_Science
- We are all learners here!

Here is a guide to install R and RStudio. New to programming? See - Hands on Programming with R (https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/) by Garrett!
We are on twitter, find us at: R-Ladies BLR.
Please feel free to reach out to us with your queries/suggestions. Spread the word.
Passcode for zoom- Please join slack for more details.

For the more details register here - https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScb8cb5wTfMx_4GlELJzkaYtKIG-PvMzOL2twWwqFGOUVFBUQ/viewform?usp=sf_link or contact bangalore@rladies.org.

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
description:
About the workshop: This will be the third meetup of R-Ladies BLR. The workshop will focus on Exploratory Data Analysis. How to encounter new data sets? What are the things that are useful to quickly get a sense of the data and how to easily achieve this in R.

About the instructor: Sushmita V Gopalan is a decision scientist at Grubhub, a food delivery company based out of Chicago. She designs and analyses experiments, conducts simulation studies to help make business decisions, and builds internal tools for data science. She arrived at data science by way of Economics at the Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IIT-M), policy research at the Institute for Financial Management and Research (IFMR), and Computational Social Science at the University of Chicago. Sushmita is also a co-organizer at R-Ladies Chicago.

Password for zoom- 000111.

For the more details register here - https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScb8cb5wTfMx_4GlELJzkaYtKIG-PvMzOL2twWwqFGOUVFBUQ/viewform?usp=sf_link or contact bangalore@rladies.org.

title: Introduction to Data Visualization in ggplot2
description:
About the workshop: This will be the second meetup of R-Ladies BLR and we are collaborating with WAQSA(Women in Air Quality South Asia). The workshop will focus on data visualization in ggplot and understanding the usage of different packages for your dataset.

About the instructor: Meenakshi graduated with an MPH (Environmental and Occupational Health) from University of Washington, Seattle in 2015. She is currently the Director of Research at ILK Labs (https://www.ilklabs.com/about-us/team#h.p_kembYhXOTX-d) working on cross-cultural collaboration to produce policy-relevant health and environmental data, and engage with multi-disciplinary stakeholders to address global grand challenges. She is a full time R-user.

For the details please RSVP and register here - https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeGZ7l-pSbRXflWXL4RcqV6PRGDGtv-7fkOjF20zBEZIxo7Og/viewform?usp=sf_link.

title: First R-Ladies Bangalore Virtual Meetup
description:
We are happy to announce that we will be kick starting R-Ladies Bangalore chapter on 12 September 2020 @ 3:30 pm IST. This event will involve talks and interactive session from the R-Ladies Bangalore organisers, mentors!

We believe in R-Ladies Global organisation's vision-

Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in working with R. We promote diversity. There is no cost to participate in any of the R-Ladies Meetup. Our goal is to exchange knowledge and experiences of R programming in a supportive environment. We also aim to produce more R speakers using this platform.

Please make sure you read and comply with our code of conduct ( https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct ) and community guidelines ( https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/blob/master/RLadiesRulesAndGuideLinesENES.md ).

We are happy to announce that we will be having the first R-Ladies Meetup along with the kick start! üéâ

Register yourself by filling up this form (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScb8cb5wTfMx_4GlELJzkaYtKIG-PvMzOL2twWwqFGOUVFBUQ/viewform).

About the meet-up: This Meetup will be focused for beginners in R. It will include: using basic R Commands and importing/exporting a dataset. It will also help in understanding data structures, manipulating the data and visualizing it. A follow up exercise is included.

About the instructor: Anupama got her PhD from the Indian Institute of Management Bangalore in March 2020. She is currently employed at Sabre Travel Technologies in Bangalore and makes market share predictions for airlines. Her interests lie in business forecasting and time series analysis. She uses R primarily for her work but is slowly making forays into PySpark and TensorFlow. She also happens to be one of the co-organiser of the R-Ladies Bangalore chapter.

üì£
Important instructions:

1. If you are a beginner and have never used R, we would recommend you to download the stable version of R for Windows (https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/old/) or for mac/Linux (https://mirror.niser.ac.in/cran/). It will be a hands-on session. If you do not have access to a system you can use the limited free cloud service provided by RStudio (https://rstudio.cloud/plans/free).

2. Also, for a smooth experience with R it is best to work with RStudio, an IDE which can be downloaded (https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/).
Here is a guide to install R and RStudio (https://courses.edx.org/courses/UTAustinX/UT.7.01x/3T2014/56c5437b88fa43cf828bff5371c6a924/).

3. If you are unable to install it in your system, you can join 15 minutes prior to the Meetup, the co-organisers can help you to set up.

4. We will share the link of the slides after the Meetup.

We are on twitter, find us at: R-Ladies BLR (https://twitter.com/RLadiesBLR) and keep a lookout here to get updates about upcoming events here.

You can find more information about R here (https://www.r-project.org/).
You can find more information about R - Ladies Global (https://rladies.org/).
Please feel free to reach out to us with your queries/suggestions and spread the word at bangalore@rladies.org. The zoom link will be shared to those who have registered for the event using the form above.
All events this year will be online.

Cheers,
R-Ladies Bangalore Team

title: #30DayMapChallenge: The good, the bad and the ugly of crafting maps with ggplot2
description:
About the instructor:
Dr. C√©dric Scherer is a graduated computational ecologist with a passion for design. In 2020, he combined his expertise in analyzing and visualizing large data sets in R with his passion to become an freelance data visualization specialist. C√©dric has created visualizations across all disciplines, purposes, and styles and regularly teaches data visualization principles, R, and ggplot2. Due to regular participation in social data challenges, he is now well known for complex and visually appealing figures, entirely made with ggplot2, that look as if they have been created with a vector design tool.

Abstract
The #30DayMapChallenge is a daily mapping challenge happening during November aimed at the spatial data visualization community. In this seminar, C√©dric Scherer gives insights in his learnings from his two participations in the first and third #30DayMapChallenge in 2019 and 2021, discussing the benefits and limitations of crafting maps in R with ggplot2 as well as learnings with regard to spatial data sources, spatial data handling in R and map design.

title: Lexical Scope and Evaluation
description:
What: Lexical Scope and Evaluation
Who: Dr. Deepayan Sarkar (https://www.isid.ac.in/~deepayan/)
Level: Beginner and Intermediate
Required: R installed in your system (that's all!)

About the instructor:
Dr. Deepayan Sarkar is an Associate Professor at the Indian Statistical Institute, Delhi Centre. He started using R in 2000 and has been a member of R-Core since 2007.

title: Meetup 10 - Research Software Engineering and Academia
description:
This is a retelecast of the UseR2021 Keynote by Dr Heidi Seibold. Heidi works at the intersection of open science, data science and health research and is a fan of science communication. She has been involved in the development of R packages including partykit, model4you, and OpenML. She co-founded the Zurich R User Group and co-organized useR! 2020.

***** THE SPEAKER WILL NOT BE SPEAKING LIVE IN THIS EVENT *****

title: Introduction to Tidyverse - Part 2
description:
Level: Beginners to Intermediate

About the instructor: Dr. Janani Ravi is currently an Assistant Professor at the Dept. of Pathobiology and Diagnostic Investigation, Michigan State University. She completed her PhD in Computational Biology at Virginia Tech and her postdoctoral research at the Public Health Research Institute, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences. Her research group at MSU works on developing computational approaches to study the molecular basis of pathogenesis and intervention of infectious diseases, using protein sequence-structure-function relationships, comparative genomics, and drug repurposing.

Janani is also actively engaged in training, education, and outreach, focusing on increasing the participation of underrepresented minorities in data science and R programming. She is the founder of R-Ladies East Lansing and co-founder of Women+ Data Science, platforms that together engage more than 1,000 members.

Password-000111

description:
Level: Beginners to Intermediate

About the meetup: A two part series on Introduction to Tidyverse, which covers all the functionalities of Tidyverse using sample genomics dataset.

About the instructor: Dr. Janani Ravi is currently an Assistant Professor at the Dept. of Pathobiology and Diagnostic Investigation, Michigan State University. She completed her PhD in Computational Biology at Virginia Tech and her postdoctoral research at the Public Health Research Institute, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences. Her research group at MSU works on developing computational approaches to study the molecular basis of pathogenesis and intervention of infectious diseases, using protein sequence-structure-function relationships, comparative genomics, and drug repurposing.

title: Analysis and visualizing population trends and spatial mapping.
description:
About the instructor: She is a global change ecologist pursuing her PhD from the University of Edinburgh. Her research includes determining what are the sources of the complex patterns of population and biodiversity change observed over time around the world. She is also the founder of Our coding club, an amazing online resource on data science for ecologists. She is also the recipient of the Anne Keymer Student Talk Prize (Overall winner 2020) ‚Äì British Ecological Society Festival of Ecology -2020 (online).

About the meet-up: Analysing and visualising population trends and Spatial Mapping.

title: RLadies BLR - Meetup 5
description:
Details -

About the instructor: Ma√´lle Salmon works remotely from Nancy, France, where she lives with her family. She is a research software engineer with rOpenSci, besides other projects. In particular, she is currently working on the "HTTP testing in R" book with funding from the R Consortium. She created the R-hub blog that features R package development. She also volunteers as an associate editor for rOpenSci's Software Peer Review (peer-review system of R packages), the main manager of R-Ladies Global Twitter account, and a member of the R Weekly team.

title: Creating R Markdown Template for Reproducible Research
description:
In this session, he will discuss how to create R Markdown templates for reproducible repetitive research work in R. This session will be half presentation, and half hands-on work so that you get acquainted with the workflow of creating an R Markdown template. This will require you to have R, RStudio (preferably version 1.4 or the recent daily build), along with packages ‚Äúusethis‚Äù and ‚Äútinytex‚Äù installed on your computer. The ‚Äúusethis‚Äù package makes creating such templates very easy and smooth. On the other hand, ‚Äútinytex‚Äù package will be required only if your desired output format is PDF. If your desired output format is HTML or a Word Document, you will not need tinytex.

About the instructor:
Maulik Bhatt is a work-from-home parent with 16 years of experience in industry and academics. One of his colleagues introduced him to R in 2017. After this quick introductory session, he started learning R on his own. He was a doctoral candidate at Mumbai‚Äôs S P Jain Institute of Management & Research in 2018 when he had to take a career break due to his health. Despite this, he continued learning R on his own. He uses R Markdown for most of his work, relying less on word processor software. He aspires to complete his doctoral study from next year onwards.

title: Looking back @ my R journey : Tips and Tricks
description:
About the instructor:
Rahul Venugopal is a fourth-year Ph.D. scholar at the Centre for Consciousness Studies, NIMHANS, Bengaluru, India. His research revolves around understanding: how we experience the world as it is, how to improve intelligence/memory, and similar questions. He relies on many statistical & signal processing tools to make sense out of the brain. He has worked in multiple research projects involving topics like brain-computer interface, meditation, sleep, cognition, well-being, etc.

Abstract:
I am a consciousness researcher exploring various puzzles involving human minds, intelligence, and consciousness. This is an experiential talk looking back at my journey through the R verse. For my Ph.D. research work I had to model some complicated functions which were not available in conventional GUI based and one of my seniors in the lab suggested R. There it began. This talk is a reflection on challenges I faced in the process of learning R, all the things I wish I knew at multiple time points in the journey and type of mentors, I wish I dodged.
